translated: The other two eons are of medium length, because they are fourteen intermediate eons in length.

original: chags pa rnams kho na la yar skye ba dang / mar 'bri ba mngon gyi /
analyzed: chags pa rnams kho na la yar skye ba dang / mar 'bri ba mngon gyi /
translated: Only those who are attached to existence experience growth and decline.

original: gzhan gyi tshe ni ma yin pas de dag la ji ltar bar gyi bskal pa rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe ni ma yin pas de dag la ji ltar bar gyi bskal pa rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: But not others. How can one establish intermediate eons for them?

original: de'i phyir gal te yang de'i tshe yar zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te yang de'i tshe yar zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Thus, if at that time, etc.

original: bskal pa phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bskal pa phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: An eon has the nature of five aggregates.

original: de dag nyid dus zhes khams kyi mdzod nyid las bshad de /
analyzed: de dag nyid dus zhes khams kyi mdzod nyid las bshad de /
translated: The Treasury of Elements explains that time is the aggregates.

original: dus mang po ni bskal pa yin no //
analyzed: dus mang po ni bskal pa yin no //
translated: Many times is an eon.

original: sil bu zhes bya ba ni lung dag gi nang du ma 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sil bu zhes bya ba ni lung dag gi nang du ma 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Scattered means not included in the scriptures.

original: gzhan dag la lta @339b ba bskyed de zhes bya ba ni 'dir lta bas zhes bya ba'i sgras ni snying rje bshad kyi sred pa ni ma yin no //üîΩrigs gzhan kho na zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi khyad par ram /
analyzed: gzhan dag la lta @339b ba bskyed de zhes bya ba ni 'dir lta bas zhes bya ba'i sgras ni snying rje bshad kyi sred pa ni ma yin no // rigs gzhan kho na zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi khyad par ram /
translated: It generates the view in others means that the word view in the verse refers to compassion, not craving.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dag go //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dag go //
translated: A different class means a different seed or root of virtue.

original: dman pa de dang de'i thabs kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: dman pa de dang de'i thabs kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The inferior ones are engaged by the means of their respective vehicles.

original: 'dir ni so so'i skye bo dang nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jug pa bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir ni so so'i skye bo dang nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jug pa bshad do //
translated: Here, the engagement of ordinary beings, sravakas, and bodhisattvas is explained.

original: de'i tshe snyigs ma lnga po 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe snyigs ma lnga po 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: At that time, there are five degenerations:

original: shin tu lhag pa ni ches bla lhag pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu lhag pa ni ches bla lhag pa'o //
translated: Very excessive means extremely excessive.

original: 'dir tshe nyid tha chad yin zhing /
analyzed: 'dir tshe nyid tha chad yin zhing /
translated: Here, life itself is inferior.

original: ngan snyigs su gyur pa ni snyigs ma dag go //
analyzed: ngan snyigs su gyur pa ni snyigs ma dag go //
translated: Degenerated and degenerate means degenerations.

original: dus kyi snyigs ma la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dus kyi snyigs ma la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The degeneration of time, etc. are also like that.

original: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order,

original: tshe'i snyigs mas ni srog rgyud par byed de gnas pa'i dus thung du 'phen par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe'i snyigs mas ni srog rgyud par byed de gnas pa'i dus thung du 'phen par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the degeneration of life causes the continuum of life to be cut off, projecting a short duration of life.

original: dus kyi snyigs mas ni yo byad rgud par byed de /
analyzed: dus kyi snyigs mas ni yo byad rgud par byed de /
translated: The degeneration of time causes resources to decline.

original: 'bru la sogs pa rnams ro dang nus pa dang / smin pa dang mthu chung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / dus kyang de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa rnams ro dang nus pa dang / smin pa dang mthu chung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / dus kyang de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the potency, efficacy, and ripening of grains and so on would be weak, and time is of their nature.

original: gnyis kyis ni zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i snyigs ma dag go //
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i snyigs ma dag go //
translated: By the two, he says, refers to the defilement and view-related residues.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i bsod nyams dang bdag nga la ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i bsod nyams dang bdag nga la ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore he says: the indulgence of desire and self-mortification.

original: 'dod pa'i bde ba nyid 'dod pa'i bsod nyams te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bde ba nyid 'dod pa'i bsod nyams te /
translated: The indulgence of desire is the very pleasure of desire.

original: der chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is attached to it.

original: yang na 'dod pa'i bsod nyams ni 'dod pa'i sred pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa'i bsod nyams ni 'dod pa'i sred pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, the indulgence of desire is the craving for desire.

original: des 'dod pa'i bde ba la chags par byed cing sbyor bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des 'dod pa'i bde ba la chags par byed cing sbyor bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that it causes attachment to the pleasure of desire and causes one to engage in it.

original: bdag ngal ba ni bdag la nye bar gdung ba ste bdag gzir ba'o //üîΩde dag rtsom pa ni bsten pa ste /
analyzed: bdag ngal ba ni bdag la nye bar gdung ba ste bdag gzir ba'o // de dag rtsom pa ni bsten pa ste /
translated: Self-mortification is the torment of the self, the oppression of the self.üîΩThe undertaking of these is the practice of them.

original: de dag goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag goms par byed pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of them.

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: go rims bzhin du 'dod pa'i bde ba dang / bdag la gdung ba bstan pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du 'dod pa'i bde ba dang / bdag la gdung ba bstan pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: respectively, in terms of the pleasure of desire and the pleasure of self-mortification.

original: ched du byas shing brtsams nas nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i snyigs ma gnyis kyis dge ba'i phyogs rgud par byed do //
analyzed: ched du byas shing brtsams nas nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i snyigs ma gnyis kyis dge ba'i phyogs rgud par byed do //
translated: They are the two corruptions of passion and of view, and they cause the decline of virtue.

original: yang na khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyis zhes bya ba yang go rims bzhin yin te /
analyzed: yang na khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyis zhes bya ba yang go rims bzhin yin te /
translated: Or else, the two corruptions are the corruption of the householders and the corruption of the renunciates, respectively.

original: de gnyis kyis ni dge ba'i phyogs rgud par byed do zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis ni dge ba'i phyogs rgud par byed do zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: They cause the decline of virtue.

original: 'di ltar khyim pa rnams ni 'dod pa gtso che ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyim pa rnams ni 'dod pa gtso che ba yin la /
translated: Householders are predominantly corrupted by passion,

original: @340a * // rab tu byung ba rnams ni lta ba gtso che ba yin no //
analyzed: @340a * // rab tu byung ba rnams ni lta ba gtso che ba yin no //
translated: and renunciates are predominantly corrupted by views.

original: gcig gis ni lus rgud par byed de zhes bya bas ni lnga pa sems can gyi snyigs ma'i bya ba bshad de /
analyzed: gcig gis ni lus rgud par byed de zhes bya bas ni lnga pa sems can gyi snyigs ma'i bya ba bshad de /
translated: The corruption of beings is explained as the fifth activity.

original: bong tshod la sogs pa nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bong tshod la sogs pa nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the decline of the size, etc. of beings.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni yar skye ba ni yang 'byung ste ;
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni yar skye ba ni yang 'byung ste ;
translated: The Pratyekabuddhas appear when the human life span is more than one hundred years, but less than a thousand years.

original: / bdag nyid kyi dbang du byas nas zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / bdag nyid kyi dbang du byas nas zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are engaged in the path from the perspective of their own welfare.

original: nyan thos sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gang dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gzhan gyi tshe bden pa mthong ba rnams so //
analyzed: nyan thos sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gang dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gzhan gyi tshe bden pa mthong ba rnams so //
translated: Those who are preceded by the sravaka are those who have seen the truths in the presence of other Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: so so'i skye bo sngon du 'gro ba dag kyang zhes bya ba ni tshogs na spyod pa dag go //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo sngon du 'gro ba dag kyang zhes bya ba ni tshogs na spyod pa dag go //
translated: Those who are preceded by the ordinary person are those who practice in a group.

original: gang dag gzhan du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams skyed par zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis sngar sangs rgyas gzhan gyi tshe dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnam pa gsum bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag gzhan du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams skyed par zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis sngar sangs rgyas gzhan gyi tshe dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnam pa gsum bskyed pa'o //
translated: Those who generate the factors conducive to penetrations elsewhere are those who previously generated the three types of factors conducive to penetrations, such as heat, in the presence of other Buddhas.

original: de'i spyod lam bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod lam skyil mo krung bca' ba la sogs pa bstan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i spyod lam bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod lam skyil mo krung bca' ba la sogs pa bstan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The teaching of their conduct means the teaching of the conduct of the pratyekabuddhas, such as sitting cross-legged.

original: 'phags pa dag cig yin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag cig yin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If they are noble ones,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have abandoned the view that holds morality and asceticism to be paramount.

original: byang chub kyi tshogs dag la zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dag ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi tshogs dag la zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dag ste /
translated: The accumulation of enlightenment refers to morality, concentration, and wisdom.

original: spyod pa ni sbyor ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni sbyor ba byas pa'o //
translated: Practice means to apply oneself.

original: chos ston par spyod do zhes bya ba ni gal te so so yang dag par rig pa ma thob tu zin kyang snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: chos ston par spyod do zhes bya ba ni gal te so so yang dag par rig pa ma thob tu zin kyang snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: If he has not attained the analytical knowledges, he should think, I will practice the teaching of the Dharma.

original: bsod nams ni 'dod pa chung ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ni 'dod pa chung ba'o //
translated: The merit is the small desire.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba dang 'du 'dzis skrag pas 'khong yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ba spang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba dang 'du 'dzis skrag pas 'khong yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ba spang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to avoid being distracted and frightened by crowds, he should avoid being surrounded.

original: 'khor yongs su gzung bar 'gyur na ni rnam par g-yeng ba dang 'du 'dzi gnyis spang bar mi nus so //
analyzed: 'khor yongs su gzung bar 'gyur na ni rnam par g-yeng ba dang 'du 'dzi gnyis spang bar mi nus so //
translated: If he is surrounded, he cannot avoid being distracted and frightened by crowds.

original: de dag rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'du 'dzis skrag pa ni sngon goms pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: de dag rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'du 'dzis skrag pa ni sngon goms pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: He is frightened by distraction and crowds because of his previous habituation.

original: bse ru lta bu ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams dang / ma 'dres par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bse ru lta bu ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams dang / ma 'dres par gnas pa ste /
translated: The rhinoceros-like one is either a householder or a renunciate who dwells in solitude.

original: bse'i rva ltar gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bse'i rva ltar gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is without a second, like the horn of a rhinoceros.

original: de ni gling gcig gi bdag po yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi bdag po'o //
analyzed: de ni gling gcig gi bdag po yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi bdag po'o //
translated: He is the lord of one continent, that is, the lord of Jambudvƒ´pa.

original: de ni gnyis kyi'o zhes bya ba ni @340b 'dzam bu'i gling dang shar gyi lus 'phags po gnyis kyi'o //
analyzed: de ni gnyis kyi'o zhes bya ba ni @340b 'dzam bu'i gling dang shar gyi lus 'phags po gnyis kyi'o //
translated: He is the lord of two continents, that is, Jambudvƒ´pa and Videha in the east.

original: de ni gsum gyi'o zhes bya ba ni byang gi sgra mi snyan ma gtogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: de ni gsum gyi'o zhes bya ba ni byang gi sgra mi snyan ma gtogs pa'i'o //
translated: He is the lord of three continents, excluding Kuru in the north.

original: de ni gling bzhi la zhes bya ba ni byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling dang bcas pa la'o //üîΩ'di ni btags pa las bstan pa yin no zhes bya bas ni mdo las ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gling bzhi la zhes bya ba ni byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling dang bcas pa la'o // 'di ni btags pa las bstan pa yin no zhes bya bas ni mdo las ma yin no //
translated: He is the lord of four continents, including Kuru in the north.üîΩThis is taught in the Praj√±apti, not in the s≈´tras.

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: This is taught in the Praj√±apti, not in the s≈´tras.

original: mdo dang 'gal ba spangs pa'i phyir mdo las ni gtso bo smos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo dang 'gal ba spangs pa'i phyir mdo las ni gtso bo smos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: To avoid contradicting the s≈´tras, it is said in the s≈´tras that the bodhisattvas are called lords because they are the foremost.

original: snga phyi med par zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma ste 'phyi ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: snga phyi med par zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma ste 'phyi ba ma yin gyi /
translated: If it is not in the future,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what is it?

original: lhan cig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhan cig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means simultaneously.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthu thogs pa yod par 'gyur du 'ong ngo zhes bya ba ni rgyu smras pa ste mthu la thogs pa yod na ni sangs rgyas rnams cig car 'byung ba dang 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthu thogs pa yod par 'gyur du 'ong ngo zhes bya ba ni rgyu smras pa ste mthu la thogs pa yod na ni sangs rgyas rnams cig car 'byung ba dang 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The reason is stated: ‚Äúlest there be an impediment to the power of the Buddha.‚Äù If there were an impediment to the power, then the Buddhas would appear simultaneously and their results would be the same.

original: gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case.üîΩAnd it is not the case that others do not practice.

original: de ni gzhan gyis kyang mi spyod do zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams nus mthu mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyis kyang mi spyod do zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams nus mthu mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddhas are equal in power.

original: mnyam zhing mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad dang mi mnyam pa dag dang mnyam zhing mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam zhing mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad dang mi mnyam pa dag dang mnyam zhing mnyam pa'o //
translated: Equal and equal means equal to all sentient beings, and equal to those who are not equal.

original: gzhan dag na re shin tu mnyam pa ni mnyam zhing mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re shin tu mnyam pa ni mnyam zhing mnyam pa ste /
translated: According to others, equal and equal means very equal,

original: grang zhing grang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: grang zhing grang ba bzhin no //
translated: like cold and cold.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral bas mnyam pa yod mod kyi mnyam zhing mnyam pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral bas mnyam pa yod mod kyi mnyam zhing mnyam pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Although they are equal in being free from the obscurations of the passions, they are not equal in being equal,

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not free from the obscurations to the knowable.

original: 'byung ba la gegs byed pa 'ga' yang med ces bya ba ni tshogs bsags pa rnams 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu 'byung ba la'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba la gegs byed pa 'ga' yang med ces bya ba ni tshogs bsags pa rnams 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu 'byung ba la'o //
translated: There is no one at all who can obstruct their appearance, i.e., the appearance of those who have accumulated the stores in other world-realms.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dag kyang mtha' yas pas zhes bya bas ni der ni gzhan gyis kyang mi spyod do zhes gang smras pa de yongs su spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams dag kyang mtha' yas pas zhes bya bas ni der ni gzhan gyis kyang mi spyod do zhes gang smras pa de yongs su spangs pa yin te /
translated: Since the world-realms are infinite, this refutes the statement that they are not used by others.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rim gyis spyod /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rim gyis spyod /
translated: How is it that the Lord Buddhas use them gradually?

original: rim gyis 'jug na ni gdul ba'i dus las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim gyis 'jug na ni gdul ba'i dus las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were to enter gradually, they would pass beyond the time for disciplining.

original: khams gyi  rgyal phran ni rgyal phran dag go //
analyzed: khams gyi  rgyal phran ni rgyal phran dag go //
translated: The vassal kings are the kings of the provinces.

original: phan tshun mtshon brtsams pa zhes bya ba ni gzas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phan tshun mtshon brtsams pa zhes bya ba ni gzas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They took up arms against each other means they attacked each other.

original: khyim bdag rin po che ni mdzod kyi spyan no //
analyzed: khyim bdag rin po che ni mdzod kyi spyan no //
translated: The precious steward is the eye of the treasury.

original: blon po rin po che ni dpung gi spyan no //
analyzed: blon po rin po che ni dpung gi spyan no //
translated: The precious minister is the eye of the army.

original: de dang 'brel ba ni 'khor los sgyur ba dang 'brel pa ste /üîΩlas dang ldan pa gang @341a * //
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba ni 'khor los sgyur ba dang 'brel pa ste / las dang ldan pa gang @341a * //
translated: The wheel-turning kings are related to them.üîΩThe wheel-turning kings are related to them,

original: yin pa dang ngo //
analyzed: yin pa dang ngo //
translated: because they are endowed with the same karma.

original: las de ni de dang 'brel par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: las de ni de dang 'brel par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That karma is related to them.

original: shin tu yul na gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sku'i yul gang dang gang zhig 'gyur ba de ni de kho nar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu yul na gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sku'i yul gang dang gang zhig 'gyur ba de ni de kho nar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are situated in the same place, because the place of the body remains the same.

original: shin tu gsal ba ni shin tu 'bar ba'i phyir dang / yid 'phrog pa'i phyir ro //üîΩshin tu rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ji snyed yod pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu gsal ba ni shin tu 'bar ba'i phyir dang / yid 'phrog pa'i phyir ro // shin tu rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ji snyed yod pa ste /
translated: They are very clear, because they are very bright and captivating.

original: ma tshang ba mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma tshang ba mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are very complete, because they are not incomplete.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i zhar la 'di yang dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i zhar la 'di yang dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This is the discussion of the wheel-turning kings.

original: yang ci bskal pa dang po pa'i mi rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang ci bskal pa dang po pa'i mi rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: But should the humans of the first eon also be called wheel-turning kings?

original: gzugs dang ldan pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs legs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs legs pa'o //
translated: Possessing form means having a good color and shape.

original: yid tsam las skyes pa'i phyir yid las byung ba'o //
analyzed: yid tsam las skyes pa'i phyir yid las byung ba'o //
translated: Born from the mind alone means born from the mind.

original: lag pa dang rkang pa dang de dag gi sor mo la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: de dag ci'i phyir @342a * //

analyzed: nges pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: @343a * // de ni de ltar mthong ba yang ma yin no //

original: rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not from seeds and so on, because they are not of a similar type.

original: nus pa nges pa'i phyir de ltar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /üîΩji ltar sa bon ni nus pa'i khyad par las myu gu'i rdul phra rab dag sprod par byed de /
analyzed: nus pa nges pa'i phyir de ltar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la / ji ltar sa bon ni nus pa'i khyad par las myu gu'i rdul phra rab dag sprod par byed de /
translated: It is not so, because the potency is restricted.

original: rdul phra rab gzhan dag ma yin la /
analyzed: rdul phra rab gzhan dag ma yin la /
translated: How is it that a seed produces the subtle particles of a sprout, but not other subtle particles?üîΩAnd how is it that it produces them in a certain place, but not everywhere?

original: de dag kyang gzhan du ma yin pa de bzhin dus bon dang / myu gu dang / lo ma la sogs pa rnams so sor nus pa tha dad pas myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu so sor nges pa skyed par byed pa nyid yin pas nges pa med par thal ba med do //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzhan du ma yin pa de bzhin dus bon dang / myu gu dang / lo ma la sogs pa rnams so sor nus pa tha dad pas myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu so sor nges pa skyed par byed pa nyid yin pas nges pa med par thal ba med do //
translated: In the same way, seeds, sprouts, leaves, and so on, because they have different individual potencies, produce individual, restricted results such as sprouts and so on. Therefore, there is no fault of unrestricted production.

original: gdon mi za bar nus pa tha dad pa khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar nus pa tha dad pa khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: You must certainly accept that there are different potencies.

original: de lta ma yin na rdo la yang myu gu la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams phrad par khas blang bar bya dgos la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rdo la yang myu gu la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams phrad par khas blang bar bya dgos la /
translated: Otherwise, you would have to accept that even a stone is the contact of the subtle particles of sprouts and so on.

original: der phrad pa rnams kyi 'bras bu skye bar yang khas blang bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: der phrad pa rnams kyi 'bras bu skye bar yang khas blang bar bya dgos so //
translated: And you would have to accept that the effect arises from those that have contacted each other.

original: dpe shin tu grags pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩsgra dang tshos byed me rigs las skye ba 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩsgra ni rigs mi mthun pa phrad pa dang bya ba la sogs pa dag la 'byung gi dri la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa gzhan las mi 'byung la /
analyzed: dpe shin tu grags pa bstan pa'i phyir / sgra dang tshos byed me rigs las skye ba 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te / sgra ni rigs mi mthun pa phrad pa dang bya ba la sogs pa dag la 'byung gi dri la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa gzhan las mi 'byung la /
translated: In order to teach an example that is very well known, he says:üîΩSound and the color of a cooked thing arise from their own type.üîΩSound arises from the contact of dissimilar types, such as the contact of a stick and a drum, and from actions, such as the action of striking. It does not arise from other dissimilar types, such as smell.

original: chos byed las skyes pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dag kyang tshos par bya ba dang / 'tshed pa po rdzas rigs mi mthun pa las skye'i sgra dang bde ba la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa gzhan las kyang mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: chos byed las skyes pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dag kyang tshos par bya ba dang / 'tshed pa po rdzas rigs mi mthun pa las skye'i sgra dang bde ba la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa gzhan las kyang mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The form and so on that arises from the color of a cooked thing arises from the cooked thing and the fire, which are dissimilar substances. It does not arise from other dissimilar types, such as sound and pleasure.

original: yon tan gyi chos ni sna tshogs yin gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yon tan gyi chos ni sna tshogs yin gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The qualities are various.

original: de ni rigs mthun pa dang // rigs mi mthun pa dag las kyang skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rigs mthun pa dang // rigs mi mthun pa dag las kyang skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise from homogeneous and heterogeneous causes.

original: de la 'bras bu'i yon tan rgyu'i yon tan sngon du 'gro ba can rnams ni rigs mthun pa dag las yin la /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu'i yon tan rgyu'i yon tan sngon du 'gro ba can rnams ni rigs mthun pa dag las yin la /
translated: The qualities of the effect are preceded by the qualities of the cause when they are homogeneous.

original: sgra dang tshos byed las skyes pa dang bde ba la sogs pa dag ni rigs tha dad pa dag las yin no //
analyzed: sgra dang tshos byed las skyes pa dang bde ba la sogs pa dag ni rigs tha dad pa dag las yin no //
translated: Sound, color, taste, etc. , arise from heterogeneous causes.

original: rdzas kyi chos ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas kyi chos ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the case for the substance,

original: de ni rigs mthun pa dag kho na las 'byung ba'i @343b phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rigs mthun pa dag kho na las 'byung ba'i @343b phyir ro //
translated: because the substance arises only from homogeneous causes.

original: yang 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod /
analyzed: yang 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the reason that the substance does not arise from heterogeneous causes?

original: nus pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: nus pa nges pa'o //
translated: The reason is that the power is restricted.

original: yon tan rnams ji lta ba bzhin du rdzas rnams la ni rigs mi mthun pa rtsom pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan rnams ji lta ba bzhin du rdzas rnams la ni rigs mi mthun pa rtsom pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The substances do not have the power to produce heterogeneous substances, as do the qualities.

original: 'di ltar rigs mthun pa dag kho na las zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //üîΩde dag dang de dag kho na de ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs mthun pa dag kho na las zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //üîΩde dag dang de dag kho na de ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: This is why the text says: ‚Äúfrom homogeneous causes only.üîΩ‚Äù The substances and the qualities of the substances are produced from homogeneous causes.

original: 'jag ma la sogs pa de ltar gnas pa dag kho na de ltar te re lde la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i rnam pa der gnas shing rnam par gnas pa la de'i ste re lde la sogs pa'i ming 'thob ste /
analyzed: 'jag ma la sogs pa de ltar gnas pa dag kho na de ltar te re lde la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i rnam pa der gnas shing rnam par gnas pa la de'i ste re lde la sogs pa'i ming 'thob ste /
translated: The straw, etc., which exist in that way, i.e., in the form of a pile, etc., exist in that way, i.e., in the form of a wall, etc., and are designated by the name ‚Äúwall,‚Äù etc.

original: grog ma la sogs pa'i phreng ba bzhin no //
analyzed: grog ma la sogs pa'i phreng ba bzhin no //
translated: Like a line of ants, etc.

original: ji ltar grog ma la sogs pa de ltar gnas pa dag la phreng ba zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob la /
analyzed: ji ltar grog ma la sogs pa de ltar gnas pa dag la phreng ba zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob la /
translated: The ants, etc., which exist in that way are designated by the name ‚Äúline,‚Äù etc.

original: de dag las gzhan pa'i phreng ba'i rdzas kyang yod pa ma yin pa ni khyed cag gi grub pa'i mtha' la yang yin no //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa'i phreng ba'i rdzas kyang yod pa ma yin pa ni khyed cag gi grub pa'i mtha' la yang yin no //
translated: And, according to your philosophy, there is no substance called ‚Äúline,‚Äù etc., apart from the ants, etc.

original: ji ltar khong du chud ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar khong du chud ce na /
translated: How do you understand this?

original: skud ba gcig dang ldan na ras yug mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skud ba gcig dang ldan na ras yug mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one thread is missing, the cloth is not perceived.

original: gal te skud pa dag las ras yug gzhan yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te skud pa dag las ras yug gzhan yin na ni /
translated: If the cloth were different from the threads,

original: de skud pa dag re re la 'du bas skud pa de ltar ras yug kyang mig dang reg pa dag gis 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de skud pa dag re re la 'du bas skud pa de ltar ras yug kyang mig dang reg pa dag gis 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then, since it would be composed of each of the threads, it would follow that the cloth would be perceived by the eye and the touch when each of the threads is perceived by the eye and the touch.

original: phrad par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phrad par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in their contact.

original: ras yug ni skud pa ltar dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ras yug ni skud pa ltar dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the cloth observed like the threads,

original: de'i phyir skad pa la sogs pa rnam pa de dang der gnas pa dag kho na la ras yug la sogs pa'i ming de dang de 'thob ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir skad pa la sogs pa rnam pa de dang der gnas pa dag kho na la ras yug la sogs pa'i ming de dang de 'thob ste /
translated: Therefore, the cloth and so on receive their respective names only in relation to the warp and so on, which are present in such and such a way.

original: dper na grog ma la sogs pa rnams kyi bkod pa'i khyad par la phreng ba la sogs pa'i ming 'dogs kyi de dag la tha dad pa'i dngos po la ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na grog ma la sogs pa rnams kyi bkod pa'i khyad par la phreng ba la sogs pa'i ming 'dogs kyi de dag la tha dad pa'i dngos po la ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the name ‚Äúrow‚Äù and so on is applied to a particular arrangement of ants and so on, but not to different things.

original: yang med pas mi dmigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang med pas mi dmigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi / 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Moreover, non-observation is not only due to non-existence.

original: mthong ba'i gegs byas pas kyang yin no snyam na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i gegs byas pas kyang yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is also due to the obstruction of seeing,

original: de'i phyir de'i tshe ras yug yod na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i tshe ras yug yod na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: then in response to that, it says, ‚ÄúIf the cloth existed at that time,‚Äù and so on.

original: dmigs pa'i gegs med pa bzhin du mi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes khyad par nye bar gzung ngo //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i gegs med pa bzhin du mi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes khyad par nye bar gzung ngo //
translated: The qualification ‚Äúbecause it is not apprehended, even though there is no obstruction to its observation‚Äù is supplied.

original: gang zhig skud pa thams cad la ras yug zad par yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig skud pa thams cad la ras yug zad par yod pa yin gyi /
translated: Some say: The cloth is entirely present in all the threads.üîΩ

original: re re la ni ma yin no //üîΩde'i phyir skud pa gcig gzung bas ras @344a * //
analyzed: re re la ni ma yin no // de'i phyir skud pa gcig gzung bas ras @344a * //
translated: But a cloth is not entirely present in each thread.

original: yug 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yug 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, when one thread is grasped, a cloth is not grasped,

original: skud pa bzhin de dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam na /üîΩda'i phyir zad par yod pa ma yin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: skud pa bzhin de dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam na / da'i phyir zad par yod pa ma yin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: because it does not come into contact with it, as in the case of the thread.

original: gal te skud pa re re dag la ras yug zad par yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te skud pa re re dag la ras yug zad par yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If a cloth were not entirely present in each thread,

original: de lta na re re la ras yug gi cha yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na re re la ras yug gi cha yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it would follow that each thread would have a part of a cloth.

original: de'i phyir skud pa thams cad la yang ras yug yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skud pa thams cad la yang ras yug yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, a cloth would not exist in all the threads,

original: ras yug gi cha rnams ras yug ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ras yug gi cha rnams ras yug ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the parts of a cloth are not a cloth.

original: 'dus pa tsam ras yug yin par yang 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'dus pa tsam ras yug yin par yang 'gyur gyi /
translated: A mere collection would be a cloth,

original: yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig ni ma yin te /
translated: but a single substance that is a whole does not exist.

original: skud pa re re la 'du ba'i mang po dag ras yug nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skud pa re re la 'du ba'i mang po dag ras yug nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted that the many collections in each thread are a cloth.

original: skud pa dag las gzhan pa ras yug gi cha yang gang zhig yod ces bya ba ni de dag las tha dad pa'i ras yug gi cha med pa'i phyir te rtsom par byed ba'i yan lag ma gtogs pa'i cha khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: skud pa dag las gzhan pa ras yug gi cha yang gang zhig yod ces bya ba ni de dag las tha dad pa'i ras yug gi cha med pa'i phyir te rtsom par byed ba'i yan lag ma gtogs pa'i cha khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang /
translated: What part of the cloth that is other than the threads exists?üîΩBecause there is no part of the cloth that is different from them, because we do not accept that there is a part of the cloth that is not a part of the composition, because there is no composition of a single substance, and because when the threads are apprehended, it is not apprehended.

original: rdzas gcig rtsom pa med pa'i phyir dang / skud pa bzung na de ma bzung ba'i phyir gang zhig skud pa dag la yod pa skud pa dag las gzhan pa'i ras yug gi cha yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas gcig rtsom pa med pa'i phyir dang / skud pa bzung na de ma bzung ba'i phyir gang zhig skud pa dag la yod pa skud pa dag las gzhan pa'i ras yug gi cha yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which exists in the threads does not exist as a part of the cloth that is other than the threads.

original: ci ste yang ras yug dbang po dang phrad pa ni ras yug gi rten du ma dang phrad pa la ltos te /
analyzed: ci ste yang ras yug dbang po dang phrad pa ni ras yug gi rten du ma dang phrad pa la ltos te /
translated: But if the contact of the cloth with the sense faculty depends on the contact of the many supports of the cloth,

original: ras yug dmigs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: ras yug dmigs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: then the cloth is the cause of the perception.üîΩWhen it possesses one thread, it is perceived because the contact of the many supports does not exist. Therefore, since the cloth is perceived while existing in the thread, the distinction is not established.

original: skud pa gcig dang ldan pa'i tshe na ni rten du ma phrad pa med pas dmigs pa'i phyir ras yug skud pa la yod bzhin du ma dmigs pas khyad par ma grub po snyam na /
analyzed: skud pa gcig dang ldan pa'i tshe na ni rten du ma phrad pa med pas dmigs pa'i phyir ras yug skud pa la yod bzhin du ma dmigs pas khyad par ma grub po snyam na /
translated: If you think that,

original: de'i phyir rten du ma zhig dang ldan pa la ltos na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rten du ma zhig dang ldan pa la ltos na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIf it is in reliance on many supports, etc.‚Äù

original: kha tshar tsam mthong na rten du ma dang ldan pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: kha tshar tsam mthong na rten du ma dang ldan pa yod mod kyi /
translated: If one sees just the fringe, it is indeed in reliance on many supports.

original: ras yug dmigs pa yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: ras yug dmigs pa yang ma yin pas /
translated: But the cloth is not perceived.

original: 'di ras yug dmigs pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ras yug dmigs pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: This is not the cause of perceiving the cloth,

original: de yod kyang ras yug ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod kyang ras yug ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though it exists, the cloth is not perceived.

original: ci ste yang ras yug dmigs pa na rten ma lus par dmigs pa la ltos pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang ras yug dmigs pa na rten ma lus par dmigs pa la ltos pa yin no snyam na /
translated: But if one thinks that when the cloth is perceived, it is in reliance on the perception of all the supports,

original: de'i phyir yang na nam yang dmigs par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang na nam yang dmigs par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then it is said, ‚ÄúOr else, it would never be perceived,‚Äù and so on.

original: dbus dang pha rol gyi cha rnams dbang po dang ma 'brel ba'i phyir rten ma lus @344b pa dang phrad pa med pas nam yang ras yug dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbus dang pha rol gyi cha rnams dbang po dang ma 'brel ba'i phyir rten ma lus @344b pa dang phrad pa med pas nam yang ras yug dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the middle and the far parts are not in contact with the sense faculty, the cloth would never be perceived, because there is no contact with all the supports.

original: gal te yang yan lag thams cad dang cig car phrad pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang yan lag thams cad dang cig car phrad pa med mod kyi /
translated: But even if there is no simultaneous contact with all the parts,

original: rim gyis na yod pas ras yug 'dzin par mi 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: rim gyis na yod pas ras yug 'dzin par mi 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: But since it exists gradually, there is no contradiction in apprehending the cloth.

original: de'i phyir rim gyis yan lag rnams dang phrad na yang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rim gyis yan lag rnams dang phrad na yang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said,

original: mig dang reg pa dag rim gyis phrad nas yang yan lag dag kho na dang phrad pa yin gyi nam yang yan lag can dang ma yin pas mig dang reg pas gzung bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig dang reg pa dag rim gyis phrad nas yang yan lag dag kho na dang phrad pa yin gyi nam yang yan lag can dang ma yin pas mig dang reg pas gzung bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it makes contact with the parts gradually, then even though it makes contact with the parts, it never makes contact with the whole, since it never makes contact with the possessor of the parts.üîΩTherefore, it is not apprehended by the eye or by contact.üîΩSince it is like this, the whole is never apprehended by the eye or by contact.üîΩTherefore, it is said,üîΩSince the whole is known gradually,

original: gang gi phyir de ltar ci nas kyang mig dang reg pa dag gis yan lag can don gzhan du gyur pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa de lta bas na rim gyis yan lag can shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //üîΩgang zhig dngos po phan tshun tha dad pa 'dzin pa la ltos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar ci nas kyang mig dang reg pa dag gis yan lag can don gzhan du gyur pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa de lta bas na rim gyis yan lag can shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo // gang zhig dngos po phan tshun tha dad pa 'dzin pa la ltos te /
translated: The whole is not different from the parts.üîΩWhatever is apprehended in dependence on the apprehension of different things

original: rim gyis 'dzin pa de ni de dag las don gzhan yin te /
analyzed: rim gyis 'dzin pa de ni de dag las don gzhan yin te /
translated: is different from them,

original: dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin no //
translated: like the circle of a whirling firebrand.

original: dper na mgal me yul gzhan du bar chad med par myur du skye ba na rim gyis dmigs bas phyis 'khor lo snyam du shes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dper na mgal me yul gzhan du bar chad med par myur du skye ba na rim gyis dmigs bas phyis 'khor lo snyam du shes par 'gyur la /
translated: For example, when a firebrand is quickly moved in one place without interruption, it is observed in sequence, and later it is understood as a wheel.

original: de las don gzhan yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de las don gzhan yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like that, but it is different from the object.

original: gzugs dang rigs dang bya ba tha dad pa'i skud pa dag la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang rigs dang bya ba tha dad pa'i skud pa dag la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: It is like threads that have different forms, different types, and different functions.

original: gzugs tha dad pa ni sngon po dang ser po'i gzugs tha dad pa dag go //
analyzed: gzugs tha dad pa ni sngon po dang ser po'i gzugs tha dad pa dag go //
translated: Different forms are different forms of blue and yellow.

original: rigs tha dad pa ni sron dang / ras bal dang / du gu la dang / koo shi la sogs pa'i rigs dag go //
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa ni sron dang / ras bal dang / du gu la dang / koo shi la sogs pa'i rigs dag go //
translated: Different types are types of cotton, silk, wool, and linen.

original: bya ba tha dad pa ni cig car steng dang 'og dang thad kar 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: bya ba tha dad pa ni cig car steng dang 'og dang thad kar 'gro ba ste /
translated: Different functions are going up, down, and across at the same time.

original: skud pa dag la'o//
analyzed: skud pa dag la'o//
translated: This is in regard to the threads.

original: ras yug gi gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ras yug gi gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because there is no cloth, etc.

original: de'i tshe ras yug gzugs dang / rigs dang / bya ba gcig pa yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ras yug gzugs dang / rigs dang / bya ba gcig pa yin par mi rigs te /
translated: At that time, it is not reasonable for cloth to have the same form, type, and function.

original: skud pa rigs dang / gzugs dang / bya ba du ma dang ldan pa rnams de'i rgyu'i ngo bor khyad bar med ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skud pa rigs dang / gzugs dang / bya ba du ma dang ldan pa rnams de'i rgyu'i ngo bor khyad bar med ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the threads, the cloth, and the action of weaving are not distinguished in terms of their nature as causes.

original: gzugs la sogs pa sna tshogs pa yin na ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa sna tshogs pa yin na ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the cloth is of a variegated nature,

original: gal te ras yug la yang rgyu dang 'dra bar gzugs dang / rigs dang / bya ba sna tshogs par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te ras yug la yang rgyu dang 'dra bar gzugs dang / rigs dang / bya ba sna tshogs par 'dod na ni /
translated: if you maintain that the cloth is variegated in terms of its form, type, and action, just like the threads,

original: de ltar na rigs mi mthun pa rtsom par yang 'gyur te /üîΩskud @345a * //
analyzed: de ltar na rigs mi mthun pa rtsom par yang 'gyur te / skud @345a * //
translated: then it follows that it is composed of heterogeneous parts,

original: pa'i gzugs dang / rigs dang / bya ba rnams re re zhing sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang ras yug gang gi ngos gcig bkra la /
analyzed: pa'i gzugs dang / rigs dang / bya ba rnams re re zhing sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang ras yug gang gi ngos gcig bkra la /
translated: because the form, type, and action of the threads are each of many different kinds.üîΩMoreover, if the cloth is variegated,

original: gnyis pa mi bkra ba yin na /
analyzed: gnyis pa mi bkra ba yin na /
translated: and one side is dyed and the other is not,

original: ngos cig shos mi bkra ba der ras yug mi mthong bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: ngos cig shos mi bkra ba der ras yug mi mthong bar 'gyur te ;
translated: then the cloth would not be seen on the side that is not dyed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs bkra ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs bkra ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the variegated form is not seen.

original: ras yug gi gzugs ma mthong bar ni ras yug dmigs par mi rigs te /
analyzed: ras yug gi gzugs ma mthong bar ni ras yug dmigs par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to apprehend the cloth without seeing the form of the cloth.

original: gzugs ni rdzas dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdzas dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because form is the cause of the perception of substance.

original: de skad du chen po ni dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de skad du chen po ni dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Thus it is said, ‚ÄúThe great elements are the objective support,

original: rdzas du ma dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: rdzas du ma dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: because they possess many substances and because form exists.‚Äù

original: khra bo'i ngo bor mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khra bo'i ngo bor mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One would see the nature of a variegated thing.

original: gal te ngos gnyis par ras yug mthong na ni gdon mi za bar ras yug dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzugs mthong ba yang yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gal te ngos gnyis par ras yug mthong na ni gdon mi za bar ras yug dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzugs mthong ba yang yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: If one sees a cloth in two parts, then one would see the form that is the cause of the perception of the cloth.üîΩBecause the action is also variegated, it would be extremely variegated.

original: bya ba yang sna tshogs pa yin pas shin tu sna tshogs pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i yan lag med pa'i phyir yan lag can med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: bya ba yang sna tshogs pa yin pas shin tu sna tshogs pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i yan lag med pa'i phyir yan lag can med do zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that the possessor of parts does not exist because it does not exist as a part of itself.

original: dang po dang bar dang tha ma dag tu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dang po dang bar dang tha ma dag tu zhes bya ba la /
translated: At the beginning, in the middle, and at the end.

original: dang po dang bar dang tha ma dag tu 'od kyi tsha ba dang snang ba tha dad pa dag tu mthong ste /
analyzed: dang po dang bar dang tha ma dag tu 'od kyi tsha ba dang snang ba tha dad pa dag tu mthong ste /
translated: The heat and the light of the flame are seen to be different at the beginning, in the middle, and at the end.

original: de'i phyir 'od kyi yan lag can gyi tsha ba dang snang ba dag mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'od kyi yan lag can gyi tsha ba dang snang ba dag mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, the heat and the light of the flame are not tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gzugs dang reg pa dang po dang bar ma dang / tha mar rnam par gnas shing /
analyzed: gzugs dang reg pa dang po dang bar ma dang / tha mar rnam par gnas shing /
translated: Form and contact are different in the beginning, in the middle, and at the end,üîΩand they are distinguished as strong, medium, and weak.

original: shas che ba dang / 'bring dang / shas chung ba'i dbye bas tha dad pa dag gi cung zad kyang gzugs ma reg pa don gzhan du gyur pa cig rtsom par mi nus te /
analyzed: shas che ba dang / 'bring dang / shas chung ba'i dbye bas tha dad pa dag gi cung zad kyang gzugs ma reg pa don gzhan du gyur pa cig rtsom par mi nus te /
translated: It is not possible to posit a form that is not contact as a separate object.

original: de'i phyir 'od kyi gzugs dang reg pa dag mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'od kyi gzugs dang reg pa dag mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, the form and contact of the flame are not tenable.

original: rtsom nas yang gcig yin pa'i phyir dang po dang bar ma dang tha ma dag tu gzugs dang reg pa dag tha mi dad par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rtsom nas yang gcig yin pa'i phyir dang po dang bar ma dang tha ma dag tu gzugs dang reg pa dag tha mi dad par 'gyur na /
translated: If they were posited and then were one, the form and contact of the flame would not be different in the beginning, in the middle, and at the end.

original: tha mi dad pa ni yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa ni yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But they are not undifferentiated.

original: de'i phyir 'od kyi rdzas ni yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'od kyi rdzas ni yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the substance of light is not different from the parts.

original: gal te yan lag dag las yan lag can gyi rdzas gzhan ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag dag las yan lag can gyi rdzas gzhan ma yin na /
translated: If the substance of the whole is not different from the parts,

original: de lta na rdul phra rab @345b cam zhig lus par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na rdul phra rab @345b cam zhig lus par 'gyur la /
translated: then only the subtle particles would remain.

original: de dag kyang mngon sum ma yin pas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo nas 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhen /
analyzed: de dag kyang mngon sum ma yin pas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo nas 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhen /
translated: And since they are not directly perceptible, they would not be apprehended by the sense faculties such as the eyes.

original: de'i phyir 'dus pa dag ni mngon sum nyid yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus pa dag ni mngon sum nyid yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThe collections are directly perceptible.‚Äù

original: gal te yang re re dag dbang po las 'das pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang re re dag dbang po las 'das pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Even though each is beyond the senses,

original: 'dus pa dag ni mngon sum yin pas dmigs la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'dzin pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa dag ni mngon sum yin pas dmigs la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'dzin pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: the collections are directly perceptible, so they are apprehended by means of observation and so on.

original: de nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir dper na de dag gi 'bras bu rtsom pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir dper na de dag gi 'bras bu rtsom pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point, he says, ‚ÄúFor example, they commence the effect.‚Äù

original: dper na re re la 'bras bu rtsom pa'i nus pa med kyang /
analyzed: dper na re re la 'bras bu rtsom pa'i nus pa med kyang /
translated: For example, even though each is not capable of commencing an effect,

original: 'dus pa dag 'bras bu rtsom par nus par 'dod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa dag 'bras bu rtsom par nus par 'dod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
translated: Just as the collection of causes is accepted as being able to produce the effect, so it is here.

original: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams ni 'dus pa dag kho na rnams par shes pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams ni 'dus pa dag kho na rnams par shes pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The eye, etc. are the collection of form, light, and attention that produces consciousness, not each individual member.

original: re re ba ma yin pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: re re ba ma yin pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab dag kyang yin no //
translated: In the same way, the atoms are the collection that produces the visual consciousness.

original: skra gram ba'i tshogs dmigs pa lta bu ste zhes bya la /
analyzed: skra gram ba'i tshogs dmigs pa lta bu ste zhes bya la /
translated: Like the appearance of a mass of hair to one with an eye disease.

original: gram pa smos pa ni 'dus pa can gyi rgyu med pas rdzas gzhan du rtogs pa bkag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gram pa smos pa ni 'dus pa can gyi rgyu med pas rdzas gzhan du rtogs pa bkag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the mass is to refute the notion that it is a substance different from the collection, since it has no cause other than the collection.

original: rdzas gzhan med kyang rab rib can rnams la ni rdul phra rab ltar skra cig dbang po las 'das pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang phan tshun ma 'dres pa'i skra'i tshogs dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzas gzhan med kyang rab rib can rnams la ni rdul phra rab ltar skra cig dbang po las 'das pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang phan tshun ma 'dres pa'i skra'i tshogs dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Even though there is no substance different from the collection, a single hair beyond the senses appears to one with an eye disease, like an atom. However, the mass of hair is perceived as a collection of hairs that are not mixed with each other.

original: yan lag dang yan lag can du smra ba bkag pa'i mjug thogs su yon tan dang yon tan can du smra ba dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yan lag dang yan lag can du smra ba bkag pa'i mjug thogs su yon tan dang yon tan can du smra ba dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Immediately following the refutation of the proponent of parts and wholes, in order to refute the proponent of qualities and that which possesses qualities,

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag kho na la rdul phra rab ming du 'dogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag kho na la rdul phra rab ming du 'dogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúbecause only form, etc. are designated as subtle particles.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni 'jig par grub ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni 'jig par grub ste /
translated: Form, etc. are established as perishable.

original: de'i phyir de zhig na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de zhig na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúwhen they perish,‚Äù and so on.

original: rdzas dang yon tan gyi tshig gi don dag ni tha dad pa'i phyir rdul phra rab ni gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan nyid yin pas /
analyzed: rdzas dang yon tan gyi tshig gi don dag ni tha dad pa'i phyir rdul phra rab ni gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan nyid yin pas /
translated: Since the meanings of the words substance and quality are different, a subtle particle is not different from form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhig na de 'jig pa ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhig na de 'jig pa ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, when form, etc. perish, it does not perish.

original: 'di ltar sus kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sus kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this way, no one

analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la ni gang gi phyir gyi don te / 'di ltar sa ston pa na gzugs sam /
translated: In this way means for the sake of which.

original: reg pa'am gzugs kyi dbyibs tsam zhig ston par byed @346a * //
analyzed: reg pa'am gzugs kyi dbyibs tsam zhig ston par byed @346a * //
translated: In this way, when earth is shown, either form or the mere shape of form is shown.

original: do ; / chu la sogs pa dag la yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: do ; / chu la sogs pa dag la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to water and so on.

original: sa la sogs pa dag ni mig dang reg pa'i gzung bar bya bar dam 'cha' na mig dang reg pa dag gi yul ni gzugs dang reg pa'i ngo bo las tha dad pa gzhan med do //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa dag ni mig dang reg pa'i gzung bar bya bar dam 'cha' na mig dang reg pa dag gi yul ni gzugs dang reg pa'i ngo bo las tha dad pa gzhan med do //
translated: If you maintain that earth and so on are perceived by the eye and by touch, then the object of the eye and the object of touch are not different from the nature of form and tactility.

original: bal dang ras bal dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩrdzas smra ba rnams kyi ltar na me dang 'brel bas gzugs la sogs pa tsam zhig ldog gi bal la sogs pa'i rdzas ni ma yin pas gal te /
analyzed: bal dang ras bal dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / rdzas smra ba rnams kyi ltar na me dang 'brel bas gzugs la sogs pa tsam zhig ldog gi bal la sogs pa'i rdzas ni ma yin pas gal te /
translated: Cotton, wool,

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag las rdzas gzhan yin na tshig pa dag la bal la sogs pa'i blor ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag las rdzas gzhan yin na tshig pa dag la bal la sogs pa'i blor ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: If, as the proponents of real entities claim, the mere form and so on is eliminated by contact with fire, but the substance of cotton and so on is not, then if the substance is different from form and so on, why does the cognition of cotton and so on not arise in burned objects?

analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa dag kho na la de'i blor 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of that arises only in relation to form and so on.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa dag las rdzas gzhan med na chos byed las skyes pa byung ba la sngar gyi gzugs la sogs pa zhig dang / bum par yongs su shes par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa dag las rdzas gzhan med na chos byed las skyes pa byung ba la sngar gyi gzugs la sogs pa zhig dang / bum par yongs su shes par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the vase does not exist as a real entity separate from form and so on, how could the prior form and so on be destroyed and how could the vase be recognized as arising from the causal process?

original: de'i phyir tshos byed las skye ba 'byung ba la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshos byed las skye ba 'byung ba la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúThe arising of the vase from the causal process‚Äù and so on.

original: dbyibs 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi gzugs dang / rnam pa chos mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbyibs 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi gzugs dang / rnam pa chos mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of the similarity of shape means because of the similarity of aspect.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad bar la bum par shes kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad bar la bum par shes kyi /

original: gzugs la sogs pa tsam la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa tsam la ni ma yin no //

analyzed: sngar gyi sla sha la sogs pa bcad pa sngar skyes pa dag la yang ma yin la /

translated: Even though they are different, ants are recognized as a line because they have a similar shape. In the same way, even though the previous form and so on have ceased, it is not contradictory to recognize a vase that arises from the action of the elements because it has a similar shape.

original: yang 'di ji ltar shes she na ;
analyzed: yang 'di ji ltar shes she na ;
translated: How is this known?

analyzed: rtags mthong bar yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'byung ste /

translated: Because a vase and so on is not recognized when the sign of its cracks, unevenness, and so on is not seen, therefore a vase is not different from form and so on.

analyzed: yan lag las yan lag can yang gzhan ma yin no //

analyzed: dngos po rtag par mi snang ste // des na rdul phran rtag par ni //
translated: A permanent entity does not appear.üîΩTherefore, the Buddha never taught

analyzed: sangs rgyas nam yang mi gsungs so // zhes bshad do // de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: that the atom is permanent.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis / 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag ste //
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn said:

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúAll conditioned things are impermanent.‚Äù

original: ston pa shes bya thams cad la gzigs pa thogs pa mi mnga' zhing ;
analyzed: ston pa shes bya thams cad la gzigs pa thogs pa mi mnga' zhing ;
translated: The Teacher, who sees all objects of knowledge without obstruction,

original: phyin ci ma log pa gsungs pa'i gsung la rnam pa gzhan du ji ltar dogs /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa gsungs pa'i gsung la rnam pa gzhan du ji ltar dogs /
translated: how could he speak falsely?

analyzed: de'i phyir yan lag dang yan lag can smra ba dang yon tan dang yon tan can smra ba /
translated: Therefore, the proponents of parts and wholes, the proponents of qualities and things with qualities,

analyzed: ji lta ji ltar rtag pa'i 'khri shing la 'jug pa gzhan gyi lugs kyi lam ma ba ltas pa de rnams kyi mi shes pa'i ling tog bsal ba'i phyir /

analyzed: de ni gzhan du blun pa nyid //

analyzed: gang dag de la yun ring du //
translated: Those who for a long time

analyzed: 'dus pa de dag bslus par 'gyur //
translated: gather around it will be deceived.

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mu stegs pa'i smra pa 'di dag ni rnam par mnyes pa na bong bu'i 'o ma bzhin du bshad pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur bas de dag la sdang ba mang du byas pa ni gtsang sbra can 'dam rdzab spyo ba 'dra ba zhig go // lam 'di ni rang gi sde pa dag gis sun phyung zin pas 'phro bcad do //
translated: Since these tƒ´rthika doctrines are like the milk of a barren woman, they are explained to be like a donkey‚Äôs horn. Therefore, those who are very hostile to them are like those who are very clean and who despise mud.üîΩThis path has been refuted by our own schools, so we stop here.

original: de yi skyon dang chos mthun phyir //

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
